page.title: 05EXHALL GRANGE SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: {Group from John Shelton,Little Heath {and Whitmore Park Junior School.} We went to visit{Exhall Grange {Special School.}It is for{handicapped {children}who can't see or hear,or who might have other difficulties.Children come from all over the place.Some children showed us round the school.It is 32 years old,and has 350 children from 4_19 years of age.There are 40_50 teachers,some of them sleep at the school.Each class has about 15 children.At the moment they are building a ramp in case there is a fire and so that people in wheelchairs can get out quickly.There are 6 houses _4 boys and 2 girls.Some of the children go home at weekends.We went to the Braille classroom.They had Braille maps and books and a typewriter.A Braille machine plugs into a computer with a voice machine.
